I think I have just the right recommendation for you!

Considering you're in the mood for a Spanish language movie, I'd like to suggest "Man on Fire" (2004). Although not entirely in Spanish, this intense action-thriller starring Denzel Washington has some amazing scenes shot in Mexico and features a strong performance from its lead actor. The plot is gripping, and the themes of redemption and sacrifice make it a compelling watch.

Alternatively, if you're open to exploring more Spanish-language films, I could also recommend "Taxi Driver" (1976), which while not exclusively in Spanish, has some beautiful scenes featuring Latin American culture and music. Robert De Niro's iconic performance as Travis Bickle is unforgettable!

Which one piques your interest?

I think I've found some great matches for you! If you're looking for a thought-provoking film that explores themes of war and its aftermath, I'd highly recommend "The Best Years of Our Lives" (1946). This classic movie delves into the lives of three veterans returning home from World War II, grappling with the physical and emotional scars they've accumulated. The all-star cast, including Myrna Loy and Dana Andrews, brings depth and nuance to this powerful story.

If you'd like an action-packed option that also touches on war, I suggest "War" (2007). With Jason Statham and Jet Li leading the charge, this film takes you on a thrilling ride as Indian agent Khalid hunts down his rogue mentor Kabir. The movie's intense action sequences and gripping storyline make it an exciting choice.
